intro: Gilia tenuisecta, commonly known as the slenderleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Gilia tenuisecta is often found in open areas such as grasslands and along canyon walls.
